DOC.brief_summary: In France, the most used humidifying system during oxygen therapy is a non heated device with weak efficiency and non-proven clinical benefits. This study aims to assess the lack of benefits of non-heated humidification compared to no humidification, as regards to the comfort of the patient receiving oxygen therapy.
DOC.brief_title: Trial Aiming at Assessing the Effect of Humidification on the Comfort of the Patient Receiving an Oxygen Therapy
DOC.criteria: Admission in Intensive Care Unit Oxygen therapy started for less than two hours in ICU Age under 18 Pregnancy Participation in other trials with the same endpoints absence of registration in french health care system patient protected by law tracheotomised or intubated patient Patient with non invasive ventilation Oxygen therapy started for more than two hours in ICU moribund
